newsitem.title: LATVIA: BLUE CHIPS EXTEND RECENT MODEST GAINS.
newsitem.headline: BLUE CHIPS EXTEND RECENT MODEST GAINS.

text.p: * Total turnover slipped to 93,000 lats against 101,000 lats.
* Rietumu index closed up 2.12pct to 187.29. It grew 6.74 percent during the week.
* Most official list shares extended gains, Unibanka jumped to 3.30 lats from 3.21 lats on turnover of 20,900 lats.
* Valmiera Glassfibre led the secondary list on trade of 15,000 lats as it 1,55 lats from 1,49 lats.
Leading stocks on the Riga bourse extended price gains on Friday as investors were seen switching from vouchers to stocks, dealers said.
Total turnover slipped to 93,000 lats against 101,000 lats and Rietumu index closed up 2.12 percent to 187.29.
It grew 6.74 percent during the week.

"The recent correction seems to have bottomed out as prices have been grwoing since Tuesday, showing the upward trend was here to stay," Robert Idelsons, Trasta Bank's securities department head, told Reuters.
"The recovery was generated mainly by local funds, switching from vouchers into stocks," he added.
"Foreign investors, who were waiting for the growth to pick up again, could return next week," Idelsons said.
Most official list shares extended gains.
Unibanka jumped to 3.30 lats from 3.21 lats on turnover of 20,900 lats.
Staburadze rose to 2.70 lats from 2.57 lats on turnover of 7,500 lats.
"This price is close to Staburadze's current ceiling if compared to its potential," Trasta Idelsons said.
Valmiera Glassfibre led the secondary list on trade of 15,000 lats as it rose to 1.55 lats from 1.49 lats.
